Module chatRetry
Package stream

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • stream.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client class allows the user to create a client to connect to the server of the chat application.
    Author:
    Nathalie Lebon et Yousra Jebbari
    See Also:
    Server, ClientManager, ChatRoomView

      Constructor of Client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.net.Socket socket,
              java.lang.String username)
        Constructor of Client. Initializes the buffered reader an writer, the username and the socket of the client. Creates a ChatRoomView for the user to see and send messages.
        Parameters:
        socket - is the client socket connects to the server.
        username - is the username of the client.
        See Also:
        ChatRoomView

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()

      • getSocOut

        public java.io.BufferedWriter getSocOut()

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String text)
        Gets a text from the user interface that will be sent to the other clients.
        Parameters:
        text - is the String that will be sent to the other connected clients.
        See Also:
        ChatRoomView

      • readMessages

        public void readMessages()
        Creates a thread the read the incoming messages and displays them in the GUI.
        See Also:
        ChatRoomView

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll()
        In case of an exception or when the client disconnects, loses the buffered reader and writer and the socket of the client.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. Creates a client with a username chosen by the user in an Option pane, and starts reading the messages.
        Parameters:
        args - are the execution parameters : the IP address of the server and the port to connect the client.
        See Also:
        readMessages()
